授業目的: The purpose of this course is to learn about Climate Justice – what it means, the inequitable impacts of climate change around the globe, and to learn from different perspectives and initiatives from Canada, Japan, other countries, and the United Nations. Students will be exposed to some practical tools and learn to reflect on their own contexts, articulate their concerns for climate justice, and propose action.
到達目標:
Students will be able to: 
1. understand and communicate the history and development of climate justice; 
2. identify key influencers and examples of leadership in Canada, Japan, and other countries; 
3. articulate the global trends and challenges for climate justice; and 
4. develop pracitcal knowledge through the use of some tools for measurement & evaluation/reflection for climate justice action.
関連科目: Climate change science and/or policy; social change; sustainability; ecological economics; power and politics; human rights; migration and climate refugees; just transition; climate action
授業の概要・背景: Climate Justice requires us to examine the climate crisis through a human rights and equity lens. Climate Justice also challenges us to look for new and different ways to address these inequities and to challenge the political and economic structures and power holders for change to best facilitate a transition towards a just and sustainable society. Drawing from theory to practice, conceptual tools and analyses, students will be able to articulate what climate justice is, the need for climate justice now, with some ideas for action.
授業方法: This course will be taught with a mixture of lectures including recorded and live guest lecturers, group discussions, practical tool use and analyses, some contextual analyses, and sharing of ideas for action through presentations and/or paper readings. Class attendance and participation in discussions will be paramount.
